importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The final days of January 2024 mark the period when the Hind Rajab family and the rescue team were killed in Gaza City, with the documentary revealing new evidence about the incident.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The 52nd Armoured Battalion, known as Ha-Bok’im, was among the first Israeli units to enter Gaza in October 2023 and has been involved in some of the most lethal operations, including hospital destruction, linking it directly to the Rajab family's killing.

keyTakeAways: The Hind Rajab family, including five-year-old Hind Rajab, was killed in Gaza City in late January 2024 during a shelling incident, with her final pleas for help going viral on social media.

The Israeli government initially claimed no Israeli forces were present and that bullet holes in the family’s car resulted from an exchange of fire, but Forensic Architecture’s satellite and audio analysis found only Israeli Merkava tanks present and no evidence of gunfire.
Colonel Beni Aharon of the 401 Armoured Brigade is under a criminal complaint at the International Criminal Court (ICC) by the Hind Rajab Foundation.
The 'Vampire Empire' company within the 401st Brigade, under Major Sean Glass, is accused of directly killing the Rajab family and tampering with the crime scene.
The 52nd Armoured Battalion (Ha-Bok’im), under Colonel Daniel Ella, is alleged to have direct responsibility for field-level killings and is linked to major destructive operations in Gaza.
Soldier Itay Choukirkov, a dual Israeli-Argentine national, is being sued under Argentinian law for his alleged role in the murder.

Shimon Zuckerman, a self-styled 'war influencer' from the 8129 Engineering Corps, is being sued by the Hind Rajab Foundation for posting videos showing the destruction of Khuza’a village, which the foundation claims demonstrates genocidal intent.
The Israeli government and security agencies, including Shin Bet and Mossad, are reportedly concerned about international war crimes prosecutions involving Israeli military personnel.

namedEntities.name: Hind Rajab
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A five-year-old girl who was killed in the January 2024 attack in Gaza City along with her family. Her final pleas for help were widely shared online, drawing international attention to the incident.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hind Rajab’s case is central to the documentary and investigation, as her death became a symbol of civilian suffering in Gaza and sparked global outrage and media coverage.

namedEntities.name: Al Jazeera
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major international news network that aired the documentary 'Ma Khafiya Aatham' (Tip of the Iceberg).
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Al Jazeera partnered with the Hind Rajab Foundation to produce and broadcast the documentary, which revealed new evidence and challenged official Israeli narratives.

namedEntities.name: Hind Rajab Foundation
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A civil society organization that has launched legal actions against Israeli military personnel and is using social media footage to pursue war crimes prosecutions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The foundation initiated and continues to lead investigations and legal actions, including ICC complaints and lawsuits, against individuals and units implicated in the Rajab family's killing.

namedEntities.name: Forensic Architecture
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A multidisciplinary research group based at Goldsmiths, University of London, that analyzed satellite imagery and audio to assess the incident.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Forensic Architecture provided critical technical evidence showing no exchange of fire, only Israeli tanks near the Rajab family’s car, undermining the Israeli government’s official claim.

namedEntities.name: Colonel Beni Aharon
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Commander of Israel’s 401 Armoured Brigade, who was present during the killing of the Rajab family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the subject of a criminal complaint at the ICC by the Hind Rajab Foundation, based on allegations of command responsibility and involvement in the killings.

namedEntities.name: Major Sean Glass
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Command of the 'Vampire Empire' company within the 401st Brigade, accused of direct responsibility for the Rajab family's murder and crime scene tampering.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The 'Vampire Empire' unit is alleged to have executed the killings and altered the scene, forming a key part of the foundation’s war crimes allegations.

namedEntities.name: Colonel Daniel Ella
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Commander of the 52nd Armoured Battalion (Ha-Bok’im), which the foundation alleges bears direct responsibility for field-level killings.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He commands the unit implicated in major Gaza operations and is accused of direct field-level involvement in the Rajab family killing.

namedEntities.name: Itay Choukirkov
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A dual Israeli-Argentine national soldier accused of participating in the killing of the Rajab family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is currently being sued under Argentinian law for his alleged role in the murder, highlighting cross-national legal accountability.

namedEntities.name: Shimon Zuckerman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A self-styled 'war influencer' from the 8129 Engineering Corps who filmed destruction of Khuza’a village.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His social media posts are cited by the Hind Rajab Foundation as evidence of genocidal intent, linking broader Israeli military actions to civilian deaths.

namedEntities.name: Vampire Empire
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A military company within the 401st Brigade, allegedly responsible for killing the Rajab family and tampering with the crime scene.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is directly named in the foundation’s allegations as the unit responsible for both the killing and evidence manipulation.

namedEntities.name: 52nd Armoured Battalion (Ha-Bok’im)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli military unit among the first to enter Gaza in October 2023, involved in lethal operations like hospital destruction.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The battalion is linked to the Rajab family killing and is accused of operating with genocidal intent and field-level command responsibility.

namedEntities.name: 401 Armoured Brigade
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli military unit that deployed Merkava tanks near the Rajab family’s car during the attack.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brigade, under Colonel Aharon, is central to the investigation and ICC complaint, with tanks observed in the vicinity of the attack site.

namedEntities.name: International Criminal Court (ICC)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An international body that has received a criminal complaint against Colonel Beni Aharon.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The complaint alleges war crimes, signaling international legal scrutiny of Israeli military actions in Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Khan Younis
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location in Gaza where the village of Khuza’a was destroyed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The destruction of Khuza’a is linked to Shimon Zuckerman’s footage, used as evidence of genocidal intent in Gaza operations.

namedEntities.name: Khuza’a
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A village in Gaza destroyed by Israeli forces, with footage showing razing by soldiers including Shimon Zuckerman.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its destruction is used as evidence of broader genocidal patterns in Israeli military operations in Gaza.

namedEntities.name: October 2023
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The period when the 52nd Armoured Battalion entered Gaza, marking the start of major military operations.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It establishes a timeline linking the battalion’s early entry into Gaza to the subsequent killings and destruction of civilian areas.

namedEntities.name: January 2024
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The month when the Rajab family was killed during an attack in Gaza City.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The killing occurred during the final days of January 2024 and is the central event in the documentary and investigation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A new Al Jazeera documentary, 'Ma Khafiya Aatham' (Tip of the Iceberg), co-produced with the Hind Rajab Foundation, reveals that the Israeli military's claim of no involvement in the killing of the Rajab family in Gaza City in January 2024 is unfounded. Satellite and audio analysis by Forensic Architecture found only Israeli Merkava tanks present, with no evidence of gunfire, contradicting the government's assertion of an exchange of fire. The investigation implicates Colonel Beni Aharon of the 401 Armoured Brigade and Major Sean Glass’s 'Vampire Empire' unit, which is accused of directly killing the family and tampering with the crime scene. The 52nd Armoured Battalion (Ha-Bok’im), under Colonel Daniel Ella, is also implicated in field-level operations and destruction. Individuals like Itay Choukirkov and Shimon Zuckerman, a self-styled 'war influencer,' are under legal scrutiny for their roles in the killings and destruction of Palestinian villages. The Hind Rajab Foundation has filed criminal complaints at the International Criminal Court and pursued lawsuits, arguing that the actions constitute war crimes and genocidal intent, raising global concerns about accountability and the ethics of military operations in Gaza.
title: Al Jazeera documentary reveals new evidence in Hind Rajab family’s killing
